TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit StylusPointProperties extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains a for each property that the WPF supports.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] ships with pre-defined <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty> objects for properties that are commonly collected by a stylus and a digitizer. You can use these built-in properties to create a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> using the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties> fields.
[!code-csharp[PacketSpy#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PacketSpy/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#5)] [!code-vb[PacketSpy#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PacketSpy/VisualBasic/Window1.xaml.vb#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty AltitudeOrientation;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty AltitudeOrientation

Docs.summary: Represents the angle between the axis of the pen and the surface of the Tablet PC.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.AltitudeOrientation> is 0 when the pen is parallel to the surface and 90 when the pen is perpendicular to the surface. The values are negative when the pen is inverted.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty AzimuthOrientation;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty AzimuthOrientation

Docs.summary: Represents the clockwise rotation of the cursor, through a full circular range around the z-axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty BarrelButton;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty BarrelButton

Docs.summary: Represents the barrel button of a stylus.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty ButtonPressure;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty ButtonPressure

Docs.summary: Represents the pressure on a pressure-sensitive button.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty Height;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty Height

Docs.summary: Represents the height of the contact point on the digitizer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The height of the contact point depends on the type of instrument that is used. The value of <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.Height> can vary when Touch is used.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty NormalPressure;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty NormalPressure

Docs.summary: Represents the pressure of the pen tip perpendicular to the Tablet PC surface.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty PacketStatus;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty PacketStatus

Docs.summary: Represents the current status of the cursor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.PacketStatus> field contains one or more of the following flag values in a bit field. Use bit operators to check the status of these values.
- The cursor is touching the drawing surface (Value = 1).
- The cursor is inverted. For example, the eraser end of the pen is pointing toward the surface (Value = 2).
- Not used (Value = 4).
- The barrel button is pressed (Value = 8).

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty PitchRotation;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty PitchRotation

Docs.summary: Represents whether the tip is above or below a horizontal line that is perpendicular to the writing surface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > This requires a three-dimensional digitizer.
The value is positive if the tip is above the line and negative if it is below the line. For example, if you hold the pen in front of you and write on an imaginary wall, the pitch is positive if the tip is above a line extending from you to the wall.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty RollRotation;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty RollRotation

Docs.summary: Represents the clockwise rotation of the pen around its own axis.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > This requires a three-dimensional digitizer.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty SecondaryTipButton;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty SecondaryTipButton

Docs.summary: Represents the secondary tip button of a stylus.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty SerialNumber;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty SerialNumber

Docs.summary: Identifies the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this value to retrieve the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> from the packet queue.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty SystemTouch;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty SystemTouch

Docs.summary: Represents the point of contact that generates the , whether initiated by a finger, palm, or any other touch.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty TangentPressure;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty TangentPressure

Docs.summary: Represents the pen tip pressure along the plane of the Tablet PC surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.TangentPressure> field represents pressure along the plane of the Tablet PC surface. The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.NormalPressure> field represents pressure perpendicular to the plane of the Tablet PC surface.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty TipButton;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty TipButton

Docs.summary: Represents the tip button of a stylus.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty TwistOrientation;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty TwistOrientation

Docs.summary: Represents the clockwise rotation of the cursor around its own axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty Width;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty Width

Docs.summary: Represents the width of the contact point on the digitizer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The width of the contact point depends on the type of instrument that is used. The value of <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.Width> can vary when touch is used.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty X;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty X

Docs.summary: Represents the x-coordinate in the tablet coordinate space.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty XTiltOrientation;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty XTiltOrientation

Docs.summary: Represents the angle between the () plane and the pen and y-axis plane.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty Y;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty Y

Docs.summary: Represents the y-coordinate in the tablet coordinate space.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty YawRotation;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty YawRotation

Docs.summary: Represents the angle of the pen to the left or right around the center of its horizontal axis when the pen is horizontal.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > This requires a three-dimensional digitizer.
If you hold the pen in front of you and write on an imaginary wall, zero yaw indicates that the pen is perpendicular to the wall. The value is negative if the tip is to the left of perpendicular and positive if the tip is to the right of perpendicular.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty YTiltOrientation;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty YTiltOrientation

Docs.summary: Represents the angle between the (x, z) plane and the pen and x-axis plane.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This applies to a pen cursor.
The value is 0 when the pen is perpendicular to the drawing surface. The value is positive when the pen is upward or away from the user.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty Z;
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty Z

Docs.summary: Represents the z-coordinate or distance of the pen tip from the tablet surface.
